note: I grew up on a dairy farm, went to a small college, and got a Ph.D. in Nuclear Chemistry from UC Berkeley in 1988. After 4 years post docing, I relocated to Portland, Oregon. I spent a decade working in bike shops before starting proteomics in 2003. I am now a senior data analyst in the proteomics core at Oregon Health and Science University.

name: Work
value: Analysis of bottom up DDA proteomics data

name: Life
value: Married for decades, no kids, plenty of cats

name: Balance
value: Staying upright on a cyclocross bike
